cards.name: Metal Energy
text: Damage done by attacks to the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to isn't Metal. Metal Energy provides Metal Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

cards.name: Dawn Stadium
text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.
Whenever any player attaches an Energy card from his or her hand to Grass Pokémon or Water Pokémon, remove 1 damage counter and all Special Conditions from that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Evolution Wish
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Dusk Ball
text: Look at the 7 cards from the bottom of your deck. Choose 1 Pokémon you find there, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Put the remaining cards back on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

ability.name: PUT
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown P is on your Bench, you may put 1 damage counter on 1 of your Pokémon (excluding any Unown).

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Each player discards the top card of his or her deck. This attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each Unown discarded in this way.

cards.name: Fossil Excavator
text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.

Search your deck or your discard pile for a Trainer card that has Fossil in its name or a Stage 1 or a Stage 2 Evolution card that evolves from a Fossil. Show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. If you searched your deck, shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Mid-air Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Sudowoodo.

attacks.name: Wood Hammer
attacks.text: Sudowoodo does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Mom's Kindness
text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Recover Energy
text: Recover Energy provides Colorless Energy. When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, remove all Special Conditions from that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Random Spark
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for as many Eevee as you like and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Volt Tackle
attacks.text: Pikachu does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Water Splash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

cards.name: Turtwig
text: If Turtwig is Confused, remove the Special Condition Confused from Turtwig at the end of each player's turn.

cards.name: Super Scoop Up
text: Flip a coin. If heads, return 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

cards.name: Warp Point
text: Your opponent switches 1 of his or her Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. You switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon, if any.

cards.name: Energy Search
text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Call Energy
text: Call Energy provides Colorless Energy. Once during your turn, if the Pokémon Call Energy is attached to is your Active Pokémon, you may search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. If you do, shuffle your deck and your turn ends.

cards.name: Health Energy
text: Health Energy provides Colorless Energy. When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, remove 1 damage counter from that Pokémon.

cards.name: Dialga
text: If an Active Pokémon has Weakness to Metal type, Dialga's attacks do 20 more damage to that Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Time Shift
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Diamond Blast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage.

ability.name: Primal Shell
ability.text: As long as Kabutops is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play any Trainer cards from his or her hand.

attacks.name: Chop Up
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

ability.name: Cursed Alloy
ability.text: As long as Bronzong is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Poké-Powers between turns.

attacks.name: Pain Amplifier
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon that already has damage counters on it.

attacks.name: Coating
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Bronzong by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Vacuum Sand
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Fighting Energy card and attach it to Hippowdon.

attacks.name: Sand Impact
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Fighting Energy attached to Hippowdon. This attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Leafeon.

attacks.name: Leaf Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Paralyze Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Comet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Raichu during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Raichu.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Hand Trick
attacks.text: Return Aipom and all cards attached to it to your hand. (If you don't have any Benched Pokémon, this attack does nothing.)

attacks.name: Delivery
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put any 1 card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Reaction
attacks.text: Switch Drifloon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

ability.name: Baby Evolution
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Snorlax from your hand onto Munchlax (this counts as evolving Munchlax) and remove all damage counters from Munchlax.

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Poké Ball
text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Future Sight
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of either player's deck and put them back on top of that player's deck in any order.

attacks.name: Healing Light
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 Energy cards and attach them to Mewtwo.

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard a Psychic Energy attached to Mewtwo and remove 6 damage counters from Mewtwo.

attacks.name: Surf Together
attacks.text: Does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon. Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

ability.name: Primal Swirl
ability.text: Once during your turn, when you play Omastar from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may remove the highest Stage Evolution card from each of your opponent's Benched Evolved Pokémon and put those cards back into his or her hand. You can't use more than 1 Primal Swirl Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.text: Does 30 damage times the number of different types of Wormadam on your Bench.

attacks.name: Quick Touch
attacks.text: You may switch Mothim with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, move as many Energy cards attached to Mothim as you like to the new Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Helix Fossil
text: Play Helix Fossil as if it were a Colorless Basic Pokémon. (Helix Fossil counts as a Trainer card as well, but if Helix Fossil is Knocked Out, this counts as a Knocked Out Pokémon.) Helix Fossil can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat. At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Helix Fossil from play. (This doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon.)

When you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Helix Fossil (excluding effects of attacks or Poké-Powers), search your deck for a card that evolves from Helix Fossil and put it onto Helix Fossil (this counts as evolving Helix Fossil). Shuffle your deck afterward.

ability.name: Freezing Screech
ability.text: Once during your turn, when you put Articuno from your hand onto your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon. That Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Bind Down
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Dark Slumber

attacks.name: Dark Resolve
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Asleep, remove 4 damage counters from Darkrai.

cards.name: Darkness Energy
text: If the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to attacks, the attack does 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokémon that Darkness Energy is attached to isn't Darkness. Darkness Energy provides Darkness Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

attacks.name: Mimic
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a number of cards equal to the number of cards in your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Chatter
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

ability.name: QUICK
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown Q is on your Bench, you may discard all cards attached to Unown Q and attach Unown Q to 1 of your Pokémon as a Pokémon Tool card. As long as Unown Q is attached to a Pokémon, you pay Colorless less to retreat that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Last Resort

cards.name: Garchomp

ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you put Garchomp LV.X from your hand onto your Active Garchomp, you may flip 3 coins. For each heads, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

text: Put this card onto your Active Garchomp. Garchomp LV. X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous Level.

attacks.name: Restore
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Pokémon (excluding Pokémon LV.X) and put it onto your Bench as a Basic Pokémon. Then, you may search your discard pile for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to that Pokémon.

cards.name: Old Amber
text: Play Old Amber as if it were a Colorless Basic Pokémon. (Old Amber counts as a Trainer card as well, but if Old Amber is Knocked Out, this counts as a Knocked Out Pokémon.) Old Amber can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat. At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Old Amber from play. (This doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon.)
As long as Old Amber is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to Old Amber by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

cards.name: Quick Ball
text: Reveal cards from your deck until you reveal a Pokémon. Show that Pokémon to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other revealed cards back into your deck. (If you don't reveal a Pokémon, shuffle all the revealed cards back into your deck.)
